characters: BACK TO KRUG, SADIE AND FRANCIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peering down from above onto this sleeping berg...

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It’s three o’clock in the morning, ladies and germs, that’s oh-three hundred in the a.m, so stay frosty, keep your eyes on the road and that dial locked and loaded. I’m Ray Richards and I’1l be your captain this evening on Red-Eye radio 93.7 the Rage... HEAVY METAL BLARES OVER OPENING TITLES as we take note of the few lonely vehicles on the main thoroughfare. We're interested in those two over there: a dark grey PRISON TRANSFER van (DEPT OF CORRECTIONS stenciled on the side) and a POLICE CRUISER following closely behind.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So the guy’s horny as hell, right? But he’s only got ten bucks. INT. VAN —- NIGHT - CONTINUOUS - MOVING GILES, 25, a clean-cut uniformed cop, drives while DETECTIVE MORTON, 40’s, suit and loosened tie, sits in the passenger seat. A dark silhouetted hulk of a FIGURE lurks in the b.g. Handcuffed to the walls of his wire cage.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: So he goes to this whorehouse -- (re: radio music) -- What is this crap? He turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: DARK FIGURE
dialogues.text: That was “Fist.” Their debut concert, April 14, 1987. They single-handedly ushered in a new heavy metal sound by applying traditional jazz undertones, the appreciation of which is... sorely lacking.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: That’s because it’s crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s genius.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: (resuming the joke) So the guy goes to this whorehouse and tells the Madame: “Lady, I need to get laid right now.” Giles titters in amusement, keeping his eyes on the road. MORTON (CONT’D) She takes his measly ten bucks, says it ain’t much, but she can still help him out. So she tells him to go in the first door he finds. Giles nods, taking a sip of coffee. MORTON (CONT’D) So he goes in the first door and finds a chicken sitting on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: A chicken?

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: That’s what he says. But he’s horny as hell, so after a little soul searching he gives in and fucks the chicken. Giles chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: DARK FIGURE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Naturally.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: (doing his best to ignore) Rides the poor thing half to death. Feathers flying everywhere, right? So the next week, he’s even hornier --

dialogues.speaker: DARK FIGURE
dialogues.text: Please, spare us the “next week,” Detective Morton.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: (irritated now) Spare you, Krug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Spare me.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: And why would I ever do you the courtesy, you piece of shit?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (nodding 0.S.) Because we’re about to miss our exit. Morton looks back. Krug’s right.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: Giles, this is it -- Giles swerves the van down the exit ramp...

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: You in a hurry or something, Krug? The figure leans forward, emerging from the shadows to expose KRUG (early 30s), a handsome, muscular man with cold, hard features.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m in a hurry to eat.

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: What, you think we’re moving you to a friggin five-diamond Hilton? They‘re still gonna feed you the same maggot-infested shit.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Hmm. Well, that is disconcerting. Sure you can’t drop me at that Hilton?

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: Pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Holiday Inn Express?

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: In your dreams, my friend. In your dreams.  This as the van approaches a red light at a quiet

dialogues.speaker: INNER CITY INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Giles looks out, waits for a couple of approaching cars to pass -- a station wagon and a heavy duty pick-up. The station wagon innocently goes by -- but the

dialogues.speaker: PICK-UP
dialogues.text: suddenly SWERVES AND RAMS THE VAN! FWAM! The truck SMASHES into the front half of the van, spinning it ninety degrees in an explosion of flying metal debris! The cops in the cruiser behind the van throw open their doors, jump out and open FIRE on the truck. POP POP POP! The truck’s windshield explodes! The cops cease fire only to hear the voice of a WOMAN 0O.S.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me? The cops whirl around to see a masked woman standing behind the open driver’s side door of the station wagon that passed the van just seconds earlier! The gunfire must have masked her approach. She levels a silenced nine-millimeter pistol at the cops and FIRES two quick, efficient shots. BAM BAM! The cops drop. The woman steps forward, calls out to the smashed pick- up: WOMAN (CONT’D) You alright in there?! A quick, silent beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: MASKED MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Never better! The pick-up’s door pushes open, revealing another masked MAN we’ll soon know as FRANCIS, early 30's. He hops out, dusts off shards of glass from the windshield, makes a beeline for the van’s passenger side door. Opens it to reveal

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: groaning weakly in the passenger seat, blood leaking from a severe gash on his head. Giles is slumped over the wheel, motionless and bloody.  Francis reaches inside, taking Morton’s GLOCK and a pair of keys, tosses them to the woman who quickly unlocks the van’'s back-door and looks inside, her wide eyes nervous and uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: MASKED WOMAN
dialogues.text: Krug? You okay? A beat. Then -- Krug sits up from the darkness -- shaken but uninjured.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Neck hurts a little.

dialogues.speaker: MASKED WOMAN
dialogues.text: (unlocking him) Well don’t sue me, I’m uninsured. As soon as the cuffs drop away, Krug RIPS the woman’s mask off to reveal a 20ish hardened beauty. Call her SADIE. Krug cups her face, gives her an intensely quick kiss.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (re: the smashed van) Whaddaya think? Perfect timing, huh? I do good? Tell me I did good.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You mostly did good.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (playfully shoves him) Mostly?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I told you, my neck hurts, Sadie.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Well, something’s gonna hurt a lot worse if you keep critiquing my handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Ooh.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (then; with urgency) c'mon, let’s get you outta here. WITH FRANCIS - He yanks Morton out of the van. Morton hits the concrete with a weak cry of pain, crippled by broken bones.  Francis looks over, sees Krug and Sadie coming around.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Francis, where’s my kid?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Don’t call me Francis. He’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: But still sad about his mom.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Then he’s the only one. This as Krug grabs the Glock from Francis, stands over Morton, taking aim --

dialogues.speaker: MORTON
dialogues.text: Are you gonna kill me? A tense beat as Krug’s finger starts to depress the trigger. Then --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Nah, I don’t have the energy. I’m starving, remember? Krug hands the gun back to Francis.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Pull that trigger, will you? Francis re-focuses on Morton -- and FIRES -- the deafening gunshot is matched by a DEAFENING ALARM CLOCK as we

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: INT. MARI’‘S BEDROOM —- EARLY MORNING A hand SLAMS down on the clock: 5:25 AM. Pan to reveal MARI COLLINGWOOD, 17 and wide awake. Natural beauty. Deep, determined breath, then -- she throws the covers off -- JUMP TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Mari, slipping into swim suit... - Throwing on shorts, tank top... - Doing a set of quick curls with small, handheld weights... - Grabs swim cap and red-tinted goggles, tosses them in duffel bag... KERSPLASH! Mari dives into a pool. We are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic hour. Sun just peeking over the horizon... Nota soul in sight. Just Mari. She surfaces from the dive, goes into a full bore butterfly, swimming all out. This girl’s clearly intense and clearly has talent. cU - MARI - in the pool - nearing the wall... increases her speed... almost there... She nears the wall, reaches out of the pool, grabs up a STOPWATCH. Anxiously clicks it. Peels off her goggles, eyes the result. Shakes her head. Disappointed. A beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You’1l do it. Mari startles slightly, spins around to see her mom, EMMA, 41, confident, fit, earthy good looks.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Well, if it was somebody else’s record you were trying to beat, you might have cause.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: One more try.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Nope. We’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Right now? But I haven’t even --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I already packed for you.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: But I still need to --  Emma cuts her off revealing the Starbucks tray and two coffees she was hiding behind her back. Off Emma -- she can’t help but crack a smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On DR. JOHN COLLINGWOOD, 45, exhausted from a double shift with the stubble to prove it (but it also makes him more handsome than he already is). He’s focused on a 50‘ish convulsing male patient, HADLEY. NURSES surround the table, assisting. Palpable tension.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Goddammit, where’s that O-neg? A nurse races in with the blood. John grabs it. Hooks up the transfusion. JOHN (CONT’D) Have the OR prep four more units, tell them to stand by. The nurse leaves. JOHN (CONT’D) You’re gonna be okay, Mr. Hadley. Try to breathe normally. (to nurse) Five milligrams dopamine -- The nurse administers the shot. The patient calms. JOHN (CONT’D) There you go, Mr. Hadley, you’re doing great. (to nurses) Alright, let’s get our VIP guest Mr. Hadley here up to the penthouse suite pronto. John looks down at Mr. Hadley who reaches out, trying to mouth a thank you -- John nods with a reassuring smile as the nurses wheel Hadley into the hall. ON JOHN - standing there as the trauma room falls silent. He exhales in relief. Scoops off his mask, runs a hand through his hair. Looks up to see EMMA peeking through the window in the door. She slowly pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Emma, I can’t --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you’re off duty, Doctor Collingwood.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: But I haven’t even --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I already packed for you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Collingwood’s SUV negotiates the winding curves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari driving. Emma in the passenger seat, anxiously flipping through a newspaper, on cell phone:

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (into cell as needed) No, I don’t see it -- hang on -- I’m in the wrong section -- Emma throws aside a mess of newspapers. Mari smiles, rolls her eyes -- Emma mouths “I know” as she brings up another section --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here, found it --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (quietly) Thank god -- Emma playfully squints at Mari. As Mari glances at Emma we notice a sidebar COLUMN on the front page of the paper Emma’s reading: KRUG’S MUGSHOT with the headline: INMATE ESCAPES. TWO MORE SUSPECTS AT LARGE.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (re: ad in newspaper) Yeah, I see it now. You’re right, the price is wrong. No problem, I'll have ‘em correct it and tell them to forget charging us. Bye. Emma flips the phone shut, stuffs the newspaper in her bag next to a stash of magazines. Emma sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You on vacation now?  10.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I’m on vacation now. We suddenly hear SNORING 0.S. Mari turns to see John, curled up in the back seat, still wearing scrubs (fresh ones) and sleeping like a baby. Mari rolls her eyes at Emma.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know. Another snore. Emma nudges John --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Dad --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (acting groggy) Whaa... purple elephant...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Are we there yet?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Making the turn now. Just as Mari slows to make the turn down a narrower side road, she notices an old rickety sign posted across from the narrower road’s entrance: THE LAKE ENDS IN THE ROAD - 1 MI.

dialogues.speaker: MARI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jeez, you’d think somebody would change that sign.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I like it. Tells me the turn’s coming up.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Fine, but it makes no sense.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Of course it does. You keep going straight, you eventually hit the water.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: The ROAD ends in the LAKE. A lake does not END in a ROAD.  11.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (still lying in back seat, arm over his face) Mari, stop stressing, you’re on vacation...

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: ...With the dreaded parents. Exactly. Stress is foregone.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’ve got some good drugs for that.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: John --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It’s the last house on the left, in case you forgot.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It’s the only house for miles, dad.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I was being ironical for god’s sake. I’m going back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Good, maybe you can dream up some new material. THEIR POV - THROUGH THE SUV’S WINDSHIELD - Mari turns into a gravel driveway just ahead of a forest-bordered dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the SUV as it makes its way up the long driveway until a two-story home comes into view behind the trees. Decent size. Could use a fresh coat of paint, but otherwise...

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: The place looks pretty good. The SUV rolls to a stop in the back of the house. Mari and Emma hop out. Take in the silence. Mari looks around, eyes the GUEST HOUSE just off the driveway on the opposite side. MARI (CONT’D) You guys fixed up the guest house?  12.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (nodding) About three months ago, when you were training... I came up and did a few things before Uncle Dan got here...

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s right... how long did he stay?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: About a week. Him and another couple... John gets out.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (re: guesthouse) Water pressure still sucks, though.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: I don’t care, can I have it? Surprised beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (trying not to show disappointment) You want to sleep in the guesthouse?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Of course she does, it’s the perfect getaway from the getaway with the "dreaded parents.”

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m looking out for all involved parties.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: -- It’s all yours.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Thanks, you guys.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Thank your mom, she did the work.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Thanks.  13.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: Okay, enough with the “thanks” already.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (back to Mari) Happy early birthday.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: -- Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari enters, lugging a suitcase and her duffel bag. She rolls the suitcase aside, drops the duffel to the floor with a THUD. She falls back to the bed. Eyes the ceiling fan. Deep breath. Trying to let herself relax... to be still fora -- nope, not gonna happen. She jumps up, heads to the suitcase, starts unpacking... JUMP CUT: - Mari hangs a couple of dresses in the closet... - Takes out a jewelry box, picks out a few select pieces, puts them on the bedside table... a couple of bracelets, watch, and a gold-chain necklace. A small medallion -- resembling a miniature gold medal -- hangs from it. Mari reads the inscription on the back: NEVER STOP GOING FOR

dialogues.speaker: GOLD.
dialogues.text: Mari rubs a finger tip across it... then sets it on the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Emma carry their luggage through the kitchen, into the living room through to the foyer and up the stairs, giving us a sense of the home’s layout. At the top of the stairs on the

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR LANDING
dialogues.text: John hangs a right, heads down the hall --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Hey you -- John turns back, sees Emma still standing at the stairs -

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How ‘bout you try bunking with me for a change?  14.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Em, You know I don’t sleep, I just... toss and turn.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, you misunderstood. You can sleep anywhere you want. John smiles, heads back her way. Emma stops him with a gentle but firm hand on the arm. EMMA (CONT’D) I’m glad we’re here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (mostly sincere) Me, too. (trying to reassure) We‘ll get there...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (gently) We are getting there. One day at a time.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Emma smiles, then leans in for a kiss. John returns the gesture. Then he drops his bag and pulls her in for a tight, playful squeeze -- Emma giggles, pretends to choke as John lifts her off the floor... then WINCES in pain --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooh -- back -- Emma smacks him on the shoulder, thinks he’s making a statement about her weight, but -- JOHN (CONT’D) Em, I’m not kidding --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari heads down a narrow path through the woods. It leads to their boat house and private dock on the sparkling lake beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari heads on to the dock, pokes her head in the boat house.  15. A small ski boat covered with a dusty tarp docked inside, quietly bobbing on the water in this enclosed, floating garage-like room. Mari steps back out, heads to the end of the dock, takes in the gorgeous scenery, the massive lake... surrounded by dense forest, the entirety of its surface curving out of view through the woodlands. A few very distant houses dot its circumference with large patches of wilderness between them. A ski boat and skier suddenly race past paying little heed to that “NO WAKE” BUOY anchored about a hundred yards out. Mari eyes the buoy. She can’t resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari butterflies full on for the buoy. Reaches out, SLAMS her hand down on it. Turns her wrist over, eyes her watch, clicks the “stop” button. This time, Mari smiles. INT. GUEST HOUSE - BATHROOM SHOWER — DAY Mari attempts to cleanse her naked young body with the crappy water pressure. But she doesn’t seem to mind.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT
dialogues.text: Mari turns the water off, yanks the shower curtain aside. One end of the shower rod suddenly POPS loose and falls.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Shit -- Mari fumbles to put it back into place -- but the fitting on the tile wall is coming loose, little bits of plaster falling into the tub. Mari finally succeeds in getting the rod back in place -- but barely... She steps out of the tub, and very, very gently pulls the curtain closed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari slips into bra and underwear. Bermuda shorts, a fresh lime green tank top. Pulls hair back, a little make-up.  16. Eyes the jewelry on the bedside table, opts for the necklace her brother gave her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari enters to find Emma putting supplies and groceries away. We note a small household FIRE EXTINGUISHER among the items on the counter. We PAN TO REVEAL John trying to pull the microwave from its dock above the stove.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: This doesn’t look like relaxation to me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’1l be relaxed once I get this friggin piece of pre-historic junk out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (a playful dig) Is it plugged in? John chooses not to hear that. Grabs a screwdriver, intent on doing surgery on the microwave’s innards.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: He didn’t hear you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m ignoring her.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Do you need the car? I was gonna head into town and see Paige.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? You talked to her?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: She finally texted me back. I guess she works at her dad’s ice cream store.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Huh. Well, good. Oh hey, you mind picking up a few things while you’re at it? I forgot some breakfast stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Sure.  17.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Here’s the list --

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: By the way, I’m pretty sure I just broke my hundred meter record out in the lake.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s great, sweetie. Did you hear that, John? He’s still focused on the microwave -- peering in at the circuitry. He flips a switch inside the casing somewhere. The microwave suddenly HUMS TO LIFE - with the door still open. EMMA (CONT’D) John -- it’s not supposed to -- John SLAMS the microwave door. Eyes them innocently.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Fixed.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (re: microwave) Goodwill.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Keys please.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (taking out his wallet) I assume you need cash?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You assume correctly. John hands her a couple of twenties. MARI (CONT’D) What about my tip?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I think you have the order mixed up -- Emma grabs John’s wallet, takes out the rest of his cash, hands it to Mari.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Have fun.  18. Mari smiles, pecks John on the cheek, heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A statue sits in the middle of the square, surrounded by the modest church, a rundown mini-mart, an old firehouse... A smattering of local CITIZENS mill about in the little shops as Mari drives the SUV up to the curb just outside the mini-mart. She hops out, clicks on the car alarm, steps to the curb. Approaches the window of a clothing shop, eyeing the summer dresses...

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (to herself) Those are so cute...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mari Collingwood! Mari spins around to see PAIGE, 17, a stunning beauty, even when wearing the required uniform of the ice cream shop she’s leaning out of: neon pink apron, black slacks, polo shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Hey! Oh my god -- Mari crosses the street, hugs Paige.

dialogues.speaker: MARI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How are you? It’s been awhile, huh?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: I know, right? Like two years?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Close to that, yeah. And you look fantastic --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Like the hair?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, I really --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Tell me inside, c’mon --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You sure it’s a good time? I don’t want to keep you --  19. Paige turns around to the very empty ice cream shop.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, yeah you’re right, I do have to draw up a report on the quarterly “crazy cone” sales and get it to New York in time for the annual stock holders meeting.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I can totally come back later --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Mari?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Get in the damn store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari and Paige sit at the table by the window. Mari takes a final lick of her mint-chocolate chip that sits atop a squiggly-shaped waffle cone a.k.a. the crazy cone. Mari considers it.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Wow. This cone’s...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: ..-pretty crazy, right? It better be. So far, I’ve calculated I’ve spent 184 and a half days of my life making those things. So you’‘re here for the...

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Whole summer.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: How are your folks doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: As good as they can be, I guess. How’s your dad?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: God, he just had eye surgery, everything’s detached, so he’s got the bandage, the black patch... he’s a mess, but you gotta love him.  20. Mari smiles. A beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (delicately) Listen, Mari, I was so -- I couldn’t believe it when I heard about your brother --

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: Yeah, me neither.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry for not getting in touch. I’m so bad about that stuff, I just --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Paige, don’t even worry about it. We‘re dealing, you know? That’s why we decided -- well, actually it’s my mom who decided to come back up here this summer... to try to get back to... I don’t know, some kind of normalcy. You ask me, this was exactly the place not to come, no offense.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Hey, I don’t have a special place in my heart for this hole. I’m outta here, first chance I get.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I’m just an advocate for moving on to new things... making new memories... does that make sense?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: It does if you can do it. So you should come over tonight. My dad‘s at my aunt’s till tomorrow. (with a mischievous smirk) Got the whole place to mine own self, oh yeahhh... Mari’s cell phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey, mom. -- Yeah, I’m with Paige. Yeah -- yeah, she looks great, we’re catching up -- Say that again -- you’re breaking up. -- There you are --  21. Over the above, Paige’s attention drifts... she’s now curiously eyeing something outside, over Mari’s shoulder: PAIGE’S POV - A LANKY KID - walking on the sidewalk, wearing a grey sweatshirt, hood over his head... MARI (CONT’D) So, Mom, I’m gonna hang out with Paige for awhile, probably go to her house, so it could be kinda late. (then; for Paige's benefit) Yes, mom, if the storm’s too intense I’1l just spend the night. Yeah, and I’ll pick up the stuff in the morning on the way home -- Okay, I will. -- Love you, too. (hangs up; to Paige) What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: There is this semi-mysterious pretty good looking unabomber wannabe dude walking on the sidewalk over there. Mari turns -- sees the guy meandering along --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (shaking a “no”; faux western accent) He ain’t from these here parts.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Neither am I.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: True, but you also didn’t cover the same fifty-foot stretch of concrete twelve times in five minutes. We’re definitely being surveilled or -- is that the right word, “surveilled?”

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (still peering out window) It’s “surveyed,” I think --  22. Mari turns back -- Paige is gone. Now standing outside the ice cream shop’s door, waving a crazy cone, yelling over at the unabomber dude.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir? The guy looks over. PAIGE (CONT’D) Yes, you, sir. Would you like to try a crazy cone? Mari watches the guy. He pauses. PAIGE (CONT’D) On the house. You don’t like it, I’ll give you your money back. The guy breaks a smile. Mari eyes him closely as he crosses the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our unabomber guy has now joined Paige and Mari at the table. Call him JUSTIN. His hood pulled back now... 15, messy hair, spotty teenage stubble... He jams the rest of the crazy cone in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: So Justin? (off his nod) Where do you hail from?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (still chewing) Okwahoma --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: You’re a long ways from home, cowboy. (amused, to Mari) I always wanted to say that -- (back to Justin) You just move here or something?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: We’re just passing through.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: And who’s we?  23.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: My dad, his girlfriend, and his brother.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: What’s up with that? Your parents divorced or something? Justin shakes his head, staring at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: They were never married. I was with my mom... Paige glances at Mari, amused at the boy’s shyness.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: So they get turns with you? I did that with my parents for awhile. It sucks monkey nuts. What did your mom -- Justin looks up, meeting Paige’s eyes for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: She died. Paige and Mari are immediately given pause by this, looking guilty. Awkward beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Alright, this is gonna sound tacky and awful, but... I’ve had enough death for one day... (to Mari) No offense.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: None taken, believe me. (then, to Justin) We’re very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: That’s cool.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: So let’s start over. I’m Paige and this is Mari with an “i” not the more traditional “y.”

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Hi Mari with an “i.”  24.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: So where are you staying on your pass through town, Justin? Justin gestures up the road.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: The uh... the Meadow something --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Meadowlark.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s it.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Did Bridgette cut you a deal?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Well, I’‘11 call her and kick her ass til she does.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Okay... thanks...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: So have you smoked any good shit lately, Justin?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Paige, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: What? I’m sorry, did that offend you, Justin?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: No, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: But why would you ask him that --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Well, Mari, I know it’s not PC these days, but in all candor, he just fits the profile. Mari can’t believe it, puts her hand to her forehead. Justin, on the other hand, breaks an amused smile and a little chuckle.  25. PAIGE (CONT’D) Now he’s laughing. Even better. Why are you laughing, Justin?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Because you're... you say what you‘re thinking... you just... let it fly...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Damn right I do, and look what that gung-ho shit’s gotten me. Five eighty-five an hour, three black polos and a pink apron. Two more months I get bumped up to green. Now Mari’s laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (nearly inaudible) Well, that’s not all it could get you.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Say again, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: That’s not all it could get you.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Yeah? What else could it get me?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: What you’re looking for. I got some back at our room. Paige and Mari exchange glances. Mari’s clearly getting less and less interested. Paige is very interested.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: That a fact. What about the rest of your posse? Would they approve?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Probably not, but they’re out for awhile. It’s my dad’s. He’s got a lot --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Well, we don’t really need a lot.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Then he really won't miss it --  26. Paige smiles. She’s in to this kid. Turns to Mari.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (getting up) Then I guess it’s closing time. Saddle up, Mari, you’re driving.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (uneasy) Listen, Paige... this... this isn’t what I do anymore...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Then just give us a quick lift there. It’s two minutes. Justin and me’1ll race in, get the stuff and get out. You can keep the car running. off Mari -- not liking this a bit -- but relenting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari‘s SUV is the only car parked in the circular drive of this run-down lodge. Paige and Justin hop out amidst stronger gusts of wind and a distant ROLL of thunder.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (to Mari through window) Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: One would be better! Paige smiles as she grabs Justin’s hand and leads him toward the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: 14. Over here. WITH MARI - HER POV - Paige and Justin disappear inside the room, partially closing the door behind them... Mari watches intently. Then nervously shuffles through radio stations. All static. Checks her cell phone. No signal. Another beat. No movement from the room. Mari shakes her head. Eyes fall on the grocery list. Picks it up, studies it: Milk, Orange juice, eggs...  27. Mari looks back toward the room. Still nothing. She exhales, more frustrated. Turns to get out of the SUV just as --

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: Suddenly RAPS on the window! WHACK WHACK WHACK! Scaring the shit out of us. But it’s just the old lady MAID.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: Sorry! So sorry, ma‘am.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: That’s okay -- that’s -- A shaken Mari realizes she’s still in the car talking through the window. The maid can’t hear her. Mari opens the door, steps out into the windstorm. The Maid holds up a room key.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: I find. This belong you?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: No, no. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: Is okay. Sorry I scare.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You’re fine. The maid smiles, pockets the key, pushes her cart away across the lot, disappears behind the motel office. Mari turns back, heads down the walkway. As she approaches, we note the LOCAL newspaper lying outside the door: KRUG‘S MUG SHOT IS PLASTERED ON THE FRONT PAGE with the headline: “FUGITIVE ON THE LOOSE.” We TILT UP as Mari knocks on the door and pushes her way into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-where we reveal Justin and Paige sitting on the bed, smoking a j.-

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: What the hell you two? They look over. Not too bothered at the intrusion.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Mari, Justin wasn’t bullshitting. This is some premium shit.  28.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: I’m happy for you. I’m leaving.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: No, Mari -- Mari turns back.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: Paige, I told you. I’m not in to this anymore. It’s fine, you two hang out, I’1ll catch up with you later. I’m here three months --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: No, screw that, we’re going. We’re going -- where’s my purse --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: How could you have lost your purse already -- As Mari helps Paige root for her purse, Justin looks up to see

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, SADIE, AND FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Step into the doorway, carrying bags of groceries. Justin’s eyes go wide --

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (to himself) Shit --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (finding the purse) Here.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (to Mari, still not seeing Krug et al) You‘1ll give me a ride home still, right?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sure she can. It’s no problem. Mari and Paige whirl around.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, FRANCIS, AND SADIE
dialogues.text: are still standing in the doorway, their eyes scanning the faces of the people they didn’t expect to be here. Justin... Paige... Mari...  29. Note: Krug has the newspaper from outside tucked under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? (to Justin; re: Mari and Paige) What the fuck did you do? Over this, a strong gust of wind blows through the room.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Francis?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: There’s a draft. Francis SLAMS the door shut. Krug turns back, glares daggers at Justin.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clearly you got your brains from your mother --

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Dad, I just brought them back here for some weed. You weren’t supposed to be here --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: We're sorry. We were just leaving.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Whatever for? Stay, please. Who are these lovely ladies, Justin?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Paige. Paige and -- and --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: He forgot your name, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Mari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari. I’m Krug, this is Francis, but call him Frank... and my girlfriend, Sadie.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: That’s a nice ride you got out there. Yours? Mari nods. SADIE (CONT’D) Nice. How’d you afford it?

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: I didn’t -- I didn’t buy it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: So it’s Mommy and Daddy's? Mari eyes them a beat. Clearly sensing the trouble brewing.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Yes. Sadie eyes Mari in amused disgust.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: I like that necklace, too. Your parents just give you everything your little heart desires I bet, don’t they?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Sadie, manners. Don’t rush to judge. It’s rude. (back to Mari; re: Sadie) She’s been stressing a little this morning.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: I think we have good reason --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: We sure as hell do.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (seeing Mari and Paige’s questioning looks ) I’m sorry Mari and Paige. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What they’re referring to is the fact my son here has unknowingly or unwittingly or just very stupidly backed us all into somewhat of a... corner... here.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: We only smoked half of one -- we can pay you.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: We have money.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I don’t doubt that, Mari, but it’s not quite that simple... Krug nonchalantly holds up the newspaper, points to his photo:

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good looking guy, don’t you think? Paige and Mari’s eyes widen. Justin looks at his father in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: What -- what is that? What did you do now?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Well, oh son of mine, your old man got himself in a few more spots of trouble in his absence.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: +.-our Lord and Savior wasn’t gonna help me this time, Paige, so I had to resort to other means of redemption which Sadie and Francis here were kind enough to facilitate.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Listen, Mr. Krug -- Krug, Francis and Sadie chuckle at that --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Krug’s my first name, sweetheart. But I still appreciate you being polite. It’ll getcha places.  32.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: This is clearly none of our business. We won’t --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Won‘t what?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: This isn’t our business --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: So you’re saying it’s a private matter.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: So even though my mug’s now plastered all over the front page of every newspaper on every street corner of this shithole little berg, what you’re really saying is... Mari’s frozen -- Krug presses:

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: is?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I’m saying... we won’t tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Ah, you won’t rat us out. I don’t know, Frank, you believe her?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think maybe I do.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Well, you should. We don’t care. We don’t give a shit, really --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Calm down, Paige.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: But I swear we won’t --  33.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Paige, shush.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do, Krug? A beat. Krug stares at Mari in intense, unreadable silence for a moment. Mari swallows nervously as Paige looks ill and Justin looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I want Mari to give me her keys.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Cool, that’1ll solve our car issues.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (explaining to Mari) We blew a head gasket on the way back. Mari instantly reaches in her pocket, hands them over.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I accept.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: So we can leave now? You can just take the car and we're not gonna say anything --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Sorry, Paige. We can’t take that chance.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: What --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Paige, just stay calm. But Paige is way beyond it now. Trembling. Eyes darting to -- the bathroom. Beckoning. Is there light coming from a window inside? A tense beat -- and then -- Paige bolts!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Goddammit!  34. Francis is closest. He barrels after Paige who SLAMS and LOCKS the bathroom door in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige heads for the small window next to the shower. Hands shaking as she tries to lift it. But this thing hasn’t been opened in years.

dialogues.speaker: HELP
dialogues.text: She fumbles for her cell phone as --

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Tries to bust down the door. No go. He turns to Krug who tosses him Sadie’s silenced PISTOL. Francis FIRES it into the lock --

dialogues.speaker: WITH PAIGE
dialogues.text: Cell phone pressed to her ear, using her other hand to force the dry-rotted window open a couple of inches, still SCREAMING as

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Suddenly SLAMS through the door -- PAIGE (CONT’D) No! No!! Francis grabs a fistful of Paige’s hair, yanks her back and SLAMS her forehead into the edge of the sink. She drops to the floor. Out cold. Francis stands there, trembling from the adrenaline rush. ON KRUG - turning to Sadie who’s still peeking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Not that I can see. Krug turns back, locks eyes with the silent Mari who’s trying her best to keep calm, the tears in check.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Thanks for being cool about this, Mari.  35. Krug shifts his gaze back to Francis as he steps out from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Knocked her silly, but she’s coming around. Krug tosses the car keys to Francis.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Back Mari’s SUV up to the door, close as you can.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (re: Mari & Paige) Shouldn’t we ask them if somebody will be looking for them?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Like worried mommies and daddies, ex-boyfriends...

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, like that.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (shaking a “no”) I think that’s a given, Sade. The only thing it changes is our average speed the hell out of here. Francis heads out the door. Sadie starts throwing their stuff into grocery bags as Krug turns back to Mari who’s now glaring at Justin. Justin feels her stare but refuses to make eye contact. Krug observes this:

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, you look at her Justin. No movement. Krug gets up, grabs Justin’s chin -- hard -- gets in his son’s face:

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, there’s a lot of different kinds of days that come out of nowhere that force you to grow up. You might think it’s the day your mom met her maker, but let me assure you, my son, that pales in comparison to this day. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRUG (CONT’D) I’1l let that pre-pubescent brain of yours try to figure out why. But in the meantime, I'll give you a clue. LOOK AT HER. Krug viciously yanks Justin’s head toward Mari. KRUG (CONT’D) Look at --

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Okay, okay -- Justin eyes Mari. A tear streams down his face as his eyes shift back to his father. JUSTIN (CONT’D) Just let them --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Ahhp -- what did I say? off this, Krug nearly squeezing the life out of Justin through his jaw bone -- as we hear another distant ROLL OF THUNDER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV drives down a winding forest road.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Krug drives with Justin in the passenger seat. In the back, Mari and a still groggy Paige -- a gash on her forehead -- sit crunched between Sadie and Francis, random possessions piled messily behind them. Silence. Krug looks over at Justin.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Put your seat-belt on. Justin obeys. KRUG’S POV - Seen in the rearview mirror, another SUV, passing them. Mari yearningly watches it go by out the side-window. A MOTHER and FATHER (30s) are in the front. As the SUV starts to get ahead of them, a cute LITTLE GIRL looks out the back window.  37. Mari and the Little Girl lock eyes. The Girl smiles. Mari instinctively manages a weak smile in return. The other SUV speeds away, taking Mari’s view of the Little Girl with it. She stares after it wistfully, her smile fading. Her gaze shifts back to the car and she notices the backseat’s CIGARETTE LIGHTER by the cup-holders in front of her. Stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. FOREST ROAD/SUV
dialogues.text: The SUV approaches a fork in the road...

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Left, right?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (irritated) Right meaning “correct” or right meaning “go right?”

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: No, the way to the park entrance is left. Right takes you to the lake.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You‘re sure?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Pretty much. Krug glares, not satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: I coulda swore it was right, Krug. ON MARI - she’s been taking this all in -- her mind racing -- she finally opts to speak up --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (to Krug) No, left is correct. (off their glares) I’ve been coming here for years. The way to the national park... the National Forest Park? -- If that’s what you meant --  38. Over the above, Mari inches

dialogues.speaker: HER FOOT
dialogues.text: up and presses the cigarette lighter in.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: It is what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Then you need to go left. Krug studies Mari’s face in the rearview. She looks sincere enough -- if not, it’s a damn good bluff. A beat. Then -- Krug turns left. CU - MARI - her face betrays the slightest hint of “holy shit, he bought it.” Her eyes FLICK back to that cigarette lighter as an impenetrable wall of trees stream by on either side of the vehicle. She swallows anxiously and looks out the window, sees something O.S. that we DON’T SEE.

dialogues.speaker: MARI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mouthing to herself) Shit -- (mouthing to the cigarette lighter) Come -- on -- PLINK. The cigarette lighter POPS OUT -- ready -- Mari instantly snatches it before Sadie can react and JAMS the burning hot end into her face! Sadie SCREAMS IN PAIN and recoils against the seat as Mari fumbles to climb over her, opening the door --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: (panicking) Fuck! Francis hurls himself across Paige and Sadie to grab Mari as she frantically reaches for the back door handle --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What the fu -- SMACK! Paige kicks Krug in the face --  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV SWERVES as Mari and Paige SCREAM -- Mari’s now trying to push the back door OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Dad, look out! Krug looks ahead, sees they’ve crossed the center line, heading for a sharp turn --

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Krug SLAMS ON THE BRAKES, yanks the wheel hard left, but over corrects --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV SCREECHES across the pavement and tumbles off the road into the woods -- INSIDE THE SUV - Blood-curdling SCREAMS as it rolls end over end, down the incline -- MARI falls back inside the SUV as -- WHAM! It SMASHES into a tree, miraculously UPRIGHT. Silence. No movement. A long beat as steam HISSES from the busted engine. Quiet. Bordering on peaceful even -- until finally -- One of the back doors opens and Paige falls out onto the ground. She looks up, blinking and dazed, but unhurt. She rises unsteadily to her feet - BAM! Krug KNOCKS HER DOWN - She looks up in fear as he towers over her angrily -- IN THE SUV’S PASSENGER SEAT - a foggy-looking Justin rubs his head, his deflated airbag deployed. A back-door opens and Francis groggily emerges, moaning. His nose has been broken and it’s a bloody mess. Krug sees it, cringes --  40.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You all right? Francis groans and raises a hand to his nose. He bends to examine his reflection in the SUV’s side-mirror. Anger bubbles across his face as he eyes his ruined visage.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Motherf-- He turns to see Mari stumble from the rear left passenger door of the SUV, dazed and unsteady. FRANCIS (CONT’D) You little bitch... Francis strides to Mari and SLAPS her across the face, knocking her to the ground next to Paige. BAM! He KICKS Mari in the stomach and she CRIES OUT, the wind knocked out of her, COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (horrified) No! Sadie emerges from the SUV, a hand held to the small, red burn-mark on her face.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Do I look o-fucking-kay?! Sadie’s about to pounce on Mari, but pauses as she sees her possessions scattered across the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (angering) Oh, no no no! She hurries forward to grab some clothing from the dirt... SADIE (CONT’D) Look at all my shit! This is everything I own. Sadie uncovers the silenced PISTOL in the debris. Picks it up, charges for Mari --  41.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think you can just fuck everything up for us and get away with it? Sadie wrenches Mari’s head back by the hair, presses the pistol to her head. SADIE (CONT’D) Do you?! Sadie gets right in close to the terrified girl.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is what you get. Sadie suddenly smiles, then lets go of Mari and turns to Francis.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s all yours. Francis nods hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: I was afraid you were gonna make me flip for it. Francis approaches Mari, leans down to grab her up when - BAM! Paige snatches up a nearby heavy, rotted branch and HITS Francis in his busted nose -- Francis SCREAMS in agony as Paige leaps to her feet and TAKES OFF like a shot into the forest -- Francis charges after Paige like a mad bull. Sadie turns to Krug who just stares at her, clearly irritated at their incompetence --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Bring -- her -- back -- here. Sadie frantically hurries to follow Francis and the fleeing Paige. ON KRUG - he watches them go. Royally pissed. Looks down at Mari, stares straight through her.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FOREST
dialogues.text: dashes as fast as she can. HOWLING like a wild animal, Francis is fifty feet behind -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige glances over her shoulder in terror, sees Francis gaining on her and Sadie not far behind him -- She whimpers in fear and pushes herself even harder -- Paige disappears from his vision as the terrain dips and she heads down a hill. She stumbles down the steep incline, leaping over logs, obstacles... suddenly TRIPS on a rock, CRIES OUT as she sprains her ankle, FALLING forward, now TUMBLING and ROLLING down the hill toward

dialogues.speaker: A SLIGHT CLIFF
dialogues.text: Paige SHRIEKS as she FALLS off the edge and DROPS five feet to flat ground. Quickly recovering, she scurries back into a SHALLOW HOLLOW in the side of the cliff, hiding herself from view. CU - PAIGE - breathing hard, trying to stay calm as -- PAIGE’S POV - BAM! - FRANCIS lands on the ground five feet in front of her, charging forward to run off through the woods, clueless that he just passed her - THUD! Paige flinches as Sadie does the same, following Francis in their blind pursuit of no one -- Paige watches with wide, panicked eyes as her pursuers disappear from view. She quickly emerges from her hiding place, gritting her teeth as she hobbles as fast as she can on her sprained ankle as -- FURTHER INTO THE WOODS - FRANCIS AND SADIE - slowed to a jog now, looking around as they see no sign of Paige. FRANCIS (CONT’D) Shit! You go that way! Sadie heads in a different direction. WITH PAIGE - hobbling through the forest, she sees a road just up ahead through the trees, a couple of cars passing... BAM! Sadie suddenly TACKLES her from behind, taking her down. Paige SCREAMS, struggles as Sadie holds her down --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Take it easy! TAKE IT EASY! I can help you. I can get you out of this. Paige’s hand gropes at her side, frantically searching for a weapon. It closes on a large ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Fuck you! SMACK! Paige SLAMS the rock against the side of Sadie’s head, knocking her away. Paige quickly stumbles to her feet, whirls around only to come face to face with Francis --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Back atcha, Paige. He cold cocks her, KNOCKING her senseless. Paige hits the ground. Francis grabs the gun out of Sadie’s waist band, aims at Paige --

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: No?!

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Krug wants us to bring her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige, her wrists tied with pieces of her now shredded shirt, is thrown to the ground next to Mari. Krug is still glaring, just as we left him, intense uncertainty raging in his eyes. Sadie and Francis stare at him expectantly. Justin stands in the b.g. Too terrified to move as

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE AND MARI
dialogues.text: sit on the ground at their feet, passive in their traumatized state.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krug doesn’t respond. KRUG’S POV - He looks from Francis to Sadie to the girls and his wandering gaze comes to rest on Justin, who’s staring at the ground. Sensing this, Justin looks up at Krug, looking uneasy at being the focus of his father’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (to Justin) You wanna finally be a man? Unnerved at this question, Justin glances at Francis and Sadie, finding no help. Krug gestures to Mari.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s your chance. She’s all yours. Justin and Mari freeze, their eyes widening in panic. Justin looks down at Mari in fear. She looks back, equally afraid.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you, gay? Krug quickly walks forward and grabs Justin by the arm, shaking the terrified kid --

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You’‘re pathetic. Krug turns to look down at Paige in surprise. She stares back at him with cold eyes, her tears gone now, a strange confidence on her face. She doesn’t care anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What did you say to me?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Paige -- But Paige isn’t listening. She rises unsteadily to confront Krug, unafraid.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: I said you’re pathetic. Krug steps forward, gets in her face, stares at her in silence as Paige smiles, her anger building. PAIGE (CONT’D) What? You gonna hit me? Go ahead. Hit me, you piece of shit.  45. Krug GLARES another tense beat. Then... a smile creeps across his face. He chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Why does everybody eventually come around to calling me that? (back to Paige) No, honey. I’m not gonna hit you. I’m not quite that predictable. Paige suddenly GASPS, flinching -- Justin, Mari, Sadie, and Francis all flinch as well, their eyes wide. Paige blinks in stunned surprise, instantly dazed. PAIGE’S POV - She slowly looks down from Krug‘s face: He’s driven a SWITCHBLADE deep into her stomach, only its handle visible in his hand as BLOOD leaks out around it. Paige looks back up at Krug in dumb silence, the pure shock on her face slowly giving way to pain as her eyes moisten, her mouth gaping open in a soundless scream. Krug wrenches the switchblade out and Paige grunts in pain. Still in shock, she stumbles backward unsteadily, her hands clutched to her bloody wound. She collides with Sadie for support. Sadie shoves Paige back down next to Mari --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Paige -- Paige -- breathe -- try to breathe -- Krug looks over at Justin and sees that he’s CRYING softly, tears running down his face. Rage suddenly floods Krug’s face as he watches his son’s weakness. Krug turns back to Mari and Paige. Paige is coughing, spitting up blood now, her life slipping away...

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (to Mari) What is wrong with you, Mari? Can’‘t you see that Paige is very worried -- and rightfully so -- that today is the last day of her life? So comfort her. Mari still keeps holding Paige but doesn’t respond to Krug.  46. KRUG (CONT’D) Mari, tell Paige that everything is gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: No -- Mari -- don’t --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Say it. Mari eyes Paige and the defiance that still remains in her dying eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: -- Don’t -- don’t say it, Mari -- Mari forces the tears back --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay --

dialogues.speaker: SAY IT
dialogues.text: Mari turns and glares up at Krug --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: No. She looks back down to Paige who manages the slightest hint of a thankful smile. Then -- her breathing fades and she becomes perfectly limp and motionless in Mari’s arms, her slumped face hidden beneath her hair. Mari looks back up to see an enraged

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Suddenly towering over her, his eyes wide with crazed FURY as he throws Paige aside and grabs Mari --

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: With a tidal wave of utter contempt and sadistic rage, Krug suddenly shoves Mari to the ground and starts VICIOUSLY TEARING AT HER CLOTHES.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (hard in Mari’s face; as he rips at her clothes) You think -- you can keep fucking me whenever you please --  47.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: NO! I don’t -- I don’t -- Krug continues to tear at her clothes, shredding her tank top, ripping her bra off --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You don‘t? You don’t think that?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: No -- NO -- please --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Mari doesn’t think that, you two.

dialogues.speaker: ON SADIE
dialogues.text: You’‘d think she might protest, but instead, she seems oddly captivated, bordering on turned on by what Krug is doing to Mari.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Then she’s a liar. Look around. Look what she did. She does think that. So you gotta make it clear. -- It goes both ways.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You hear that, Mari? Sadie says it goes both ways. Mari screams as Krug shoves her head in the damp earth, muffling the sound. Mari tries to crawl away, but Krug puts his full weight on the small of her back as he starts yanking at her shorts. MARI’S HANDS CLAW at the earth as Krug pulls her shorts and underwear down.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARI
dialogues.text: She lifts her head up, locks eyes with a frozen Justin --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Justin -- please -- help me --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: You stay right there, Justin.  48. Justin backs away, tears streaming. He presses up against a tree, then slinks to the ground -- and turns away. cU - MARI - Her eyes stream with tears as Krug -- O.S. -- thrusts at her from behind, savagely... Sadie watches. Wide-eyed. Psychotically mesmerized. Francis’ eyes are more uncertain. Yet he remains still.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: Please... no...

dialogues.speaker: ON MARI
dialogues.text: Suddenly grow cold, almost lifeless... as if she’s giving in, her body going limp in surrender... until --

dialogues.speaker: HER GOLD CHAIN
dialogues.text: falls into frame -- clinging to her muddy cheek -- the gold medallion -- in soft focus -- sliding its way forward from 0.8. Mari’s eyes shift to it for a beat -- her hand starts to grab at it -- Krug sees this.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What, you want that? Well you can’t have it. He RIPS it off her neck.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: No! No... no...

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. Yes. Krug tosses the necklace to Justin who lets it land in the dirt beside him.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (to Justin; re: necklace) Hey, you don’t want that, I’11l take it. Justin stares at her. Then grabs the necklace, gently puts it in his jeans pocket as -- cU - MARI - she turns her head forward, peering ahead of her into the woods as the PAIN becomes overwhelming, forcing  49.

dialogues.speaker: HER OUTSTRETCHED ARM AND HAND
dialogues.text: to claw at the earth in agony, clinging to it... her fingertips disappearing an inch down where they suddenly come into contact with something SOLID. ON MARI - her eyes react to the sensation, the slightest tinge of hope and determination re-emerging if only for an instant as --

dialogues.speaker: HER MUD-CAKED FINGERTIPS
dialogues.text: Start scraping away... faster and faster to expose -- only to us -- a good-size ROCK whose purpose has come. ON KRUG - He finishes -- catches his breath for a beat -- then pulls himself off Mari. He steps aside, starts pulling his pants up as he locks eyes with Justin.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You could have stopped me. I would've let you. Mari suddenly gets to her knees, convulses -- doubles over, coughing. She looks over, locks eyes with Justin who looks away. Krug heads over, kneels down to Mari.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still think you can fuck me any time? Mari doesn’t answer. Blankly stares off toward the lake - - her spirit all but broken:

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (soft; to herself) I swim... love to swim...

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I’m happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (practically mumbling this) I can do it... can do it...one more try mom... Krug and Sadie trade a slightly weirded-out look as MARI’S FIST CLENCHES THAT ROCK - TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: What can you do for mommy, sweetie? One more try at what? Mari turns, locks eyes with Sadie:  50.

dialogues.speaker: MART
dialogues.text: (re: Krug next to her) Fucking him. WHACK! Mari spins and SLAMS the rock across Krug’s temple. Bulls-eye. Mari pulls herself up and RUNS FULL ON for the lake.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Goddammit! ! Sadie raises the gun and fires. The bullets SPLINTER tree trunks as Mari runs past them.

dialogues.speaker: WITH KRUG
dialogues.text: He staggers to his feet, RIPS the gun from Sadie’s hand and bolts after Mari.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARI
dialogues.text: Looking back, sees Krug racing after her, Sadie and Francis not far behind... She summons whatever strength she has left, INCREASES HER SPEED... just 50 yards from the shoreline... ON KRUG - He FIRES again. Misses. Stops his pursuit. Takes a steadier aim and FIRES again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks up from a magazine, hearing the distant POP of gunfire. He gets up, slides the glass door open, steps out onto the screened-in

dialogues.speaker: BACK PORCH
dialogues.text: cU - JOHN - listening intently. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOREST --
dialogues.text: CU - MARI’S FACE - TERROR-STRICKEN, BUT DETERMINED TO MAKE IT TO THE WATER... TO SALVATION...  51. BACK TO JOHN - stepping quietly outside, staring off into the woods... almost as if sensing his daughter’s plight as -- POP! KRUG - running full on - FIRES again. WITH MARI - she’s 20 feet from the water... 10... 5... ... far enough... WIDER - MARI DIVES FOR HER LIFE. Disappears under the water. Krug reaches the shore, halts his pursuit. Waits for Mari to surface. He takes aim... ready... Silence. +.-where the hell is she... THEN --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: surfaces, doing the fastest, most full-on butterfly we’ve ever seen, the water splashing around her, making it difficult for

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: To get a clear view of her body. He FIRES two shots. The bullets skip off the water next to Mari.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Fuck! He stops. Watching her swim away. Disbelief. Sadie runs up.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: You‘re not going after her? Krug glares.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Sadie, my face is all over the newspaper, not a fucking Wheatie’s box. (off Sadie’s look; re: Mari swimming away) You think I can keep up with that shit? Fuck this. Fuck her. Almost as if giving up, Krug spins back toward the lake and Mari, and fires at her again -- if there’s ever a shot that should miss, it’s this one, because Krug only half-asses it. But --  52.

dialogues.speaker: POP
dialogues.text: ON MARI - in the shittiest timing in the history of cinema -- on the upstroke to get her breath --

dialogues.speaker: THE BULLET
dialogues.text: Finds its mark. The back of MARI’S RIGHT SHOULDER Suddenly -- and very SHOCKINGLY -- EXPLODES in a spray of blood. BACK ON SADIE - She sees the spray of crimson in the splashes around Mari.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: You got her.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You’re shittin’ me. A surprised Krug turns back around, focuses on Mari. THEIR POV - FAR OUT IN THE LAKE - Mari -- now flipped on her back -- unmoving -- floating away on the current. BACK TO SCENE - KRUG - keeps his eyes on Mari. AERIAL POV - LOOKING DOWN ON MARI - as she floats away -- her wide open, unblinking eyes staring up at THE GATHERING STORM CLOUDS as a pool of dark red blood expands out around her in the water.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KRUG, SADIE AND FRANCIS
dialogues.text: As the first drops of rain start to fall -- the first FLASHES of lightning in the distant foothills... Krug tucks the gun in his waistband, turns, heads back toward the forest and crash site as Sadie follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krug, Francis, and Sadie make their way back up to the crashed SUV. Justin’s still sitting against the tree staring at Paige’s body.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: So... Anybody know where the hell we are?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Well... Krug looks over, sees hints of a freshly “paved” trail leading back up presumably toward the unseen road, its brush and small trees toppled and flattened by the SUV as it tumbled to its final resting place.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looks like we’re just off the road a tad.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Trust me, it’s more than a tad.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t we bury her?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Along with the car? Sure, you go ahead and do that. Me and Sadie are gonna find our way the hell out of here. More lightning and thunder. The storm’s closing in, the rain growing steadier as Krug eyes Justin. KRUG (CONT’D) Justin, let’s go. The boy still just stares at Paige’s body in a daze as if nothing’s changed, oblivious to the rain. KRUG (CONT’D) Justin, are you coming or you just gonna sit there and process? No response. Krug charges over to Justin and grabs his arm, roughly pulls the limp boy to his feet and drags him through the rain. Francis and Sadie follow...  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krug, Francis, Justin, Sadie, walking on the shoulder. We PULL BACK to reveal the “LAKE ENDS IN THE ROAD” SIGN coming into frame as they approach. Krug eyes it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Oh, that’s helpful.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (eyeing the wording) Does that make any sense to you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (nodding 0.S.) That a house through there? Krug turns, focuses his gaze through the trees lining the narrow side road whose entrance they’re standing across from. They see the shimmer of lights on the front porch and in the upstairs windows..

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: You‘re right.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Well, I’‘ll be. The gods continue to smile and light our way on this... (re: pouring rain) ..-lovely, lovely day. off this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON the HISSING STATIC of a small TV. It disappears as the TV’s clicked off. John, at the kitchen table, tosses the remote aside, his half-eaten dinner in front of him, eating alone. The sound of muted POUNDING RAIN is constant. John gets up, heads to the sink, peers out the window as Emma enters.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Man, I can’t remember the last time we had one this bad.  55.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I’1l get some candles out just in case. DING DONG. Both John and Emma freeze for a moment and then look at each other in surprise. Then -- BANG, BANG, BANG on the door. It’s urgent.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is opened to expose a soaking-wet Krug standing outside, his hands on the shoulders of a dazed Justin standing in front of him. Francis and Sadie stand behind them in the downpour, Francis with a bloody piece of clothing held to his nose.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Oh my god --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Hello, hi... um... I think we just rolled our car off the road -- CUT TO BLACK. DARKNESS. A beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: This is gonna hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cU - Francis’ bloody BUSTED NOSE. FINGERS suddenly appear and grab it, twisting the cartilage back into place with a sickening SNAP as fresh blood oozes out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Jesus -- FUCK! WIDER - John sits next to Francis, presses a towel to his newly reset nose. Emma’s in the b.g. making coffee.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit -- shit.  56.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Calm down. Deep breath. Worst part’s over.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Deep breath deep breath -- Standing against the counter draped in towels, Krug and Sadie wince.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I was just saying to Sadie here a little while ago that despite everything, we’re still having a pretty lucky day... first seeing your house, then you being a doctor... John chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That I am, but you still need to get to a hospital. All of you do.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Doc, we don’t really have the best health coverage right now.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. Insurance or not, they still have to treat you.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Oh. Well in that case... Do you think you could give us a lift?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Of course. Only one problem --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Our daughter has the car. She’s spending the night at a friend’s. Emma hands Krug a steaming cup of coffee --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mrs. Collingwood.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Emma. She hands another mug to Sadie.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Emma.  57. Sadie looks around at the kitchen in awe.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a really beautiful kitchen. Everything’s so white and squeaky clean. Emma‘s a little weirded out by Sadie’s childlike leering.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) Oh. Thanks. (to Justin) Justin, do you want some hot chocolate? Justin sits across the room in a chair by the corner, staring ahead blankly with a towel wrapped around him.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (smiling) If he doesn’t, it’ll be a first. (to Justin) What do you say, Justin? Justin slowly looks up at Krug. Keeping his voice pleasant, Krug makes firm “answer me” eyes at him. Justin robotically looks to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes, please. Francis flinches a little as John roots through his medical bag on the table, digs out some stitches and needle, starts sewing the gash on his nose.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Try not to move. Emma stirs some cocoa powder into a bright RED MUG.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (to Krug) What were you doing out in the storm anyway?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: We're just your typical clueless city slickers. We came out here for a day at the lake. We knew it Might rain, but we didn’t know it would be a damn hurricane.  58.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Neither did the airhead weather babe. (off Emma’s glare) Okay, she wasn’t an airhead. Krug chuckles at John’s joke. Then:

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Anyway, two wrong turns and one slippery ass road later, our car’s wrapped around a tree.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: That’s putting it mildly. Emma finishes stirring the hot chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Yeesh. I’m so sorry. She walks to Justin and offers it to him, smiling warmly. Justin slowly looks up Emma in silent misery. After a moment, he reaches out and takes the mug from her.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Thank you. Unnerved at his gaze, Emma nods.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Sure. You’re okay, Justin. I can‘t imagine what you just went through, but you’re okay. Okay? She smiles, walks back to the counter as Francis flinches again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Owfuck.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Almost there. Seeing Emma’s concern for Justin, Krug quickly gestures to a “Happy Birthday” banner hanging on the wall in the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: So who’s birthday is it? Yours, Emma? Let me guess... Krug narrows his eyes at Emma, mock-thinking. He points at her decisively.  59. KRUG (CONT’D) Twenty-eight. Emma laughs as John smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t think flattery will get you too far.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: How would you know? John snorts, half in amusement, half in irritation.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Krug) Our daughter turns eighteen tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s a fun age. She's legal, dad.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Don’t remind me. John finishes stitching Francis’ nose.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Done. Just let me clean it off. John sloshes some disinfectant on a small folded cloth.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This’‘1l sting. John touches the cloth to Francis’ nose and he grits his teeth in pain.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Mind if I use your land line?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Sure, it’s right there.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (heading to phone) We can’t get through on our crappy cells --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: The service is so bad up here...  60.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (heading to the phone) I’ll see if I can’t just get us a tow truck... or a cab to take us in to town...

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: You sure that’s a good idea, Krug? Krug pauses. Glares at Sadie, pissed at her questioning him --

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (covering) I mean, do they even have taxis here?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: They might have one or two.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
