dialogues.text: (re: storm) Good luck getting anyone out here. Krug grabs the phone off the wall just as OUTSIDE - a very close, very loud BOLT OF LIGHTNING RIPS through the branch of a tree. Sparks FLY as the branch falls into the phone and power lines, severing their connection to the house. BACK IN THE KITCHEN - the lights GO OUT.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: (re: dead phone) I think that luck might be waning... Krug hangs up the dead phone.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, we're prepared. Emma fishes around, digs out the matches and candles, starts lighting as John secures a butterfly bandage to Francis’ nose.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Looks like we’re prisoners in our own home.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Well, I can think of worse places...  61. John slaps Francis on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Francis) You're fixed for now, my friend. Francis rises.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Thanks, I think. Emma hands Francis a mug of coffee and he eyes the attractive woman with interest. FRANCIS (CONT’D) And thank you. Emma notices Francis’ hungry eyes --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Emma; re: Mari) Em, will you see if our cell, by some miracle, has maybe just half a bar?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Sure. Emma gladly steps out. Francis watches her all the way.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’ll get a fire going.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Can we pick the right house to roll a car in front of or what? curt TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm rages. Gusting winds make white caps on the lake’s surface. We slowly PAN ACROSS and TILT DOWN to find that “NO WAKE” buoy thrashing about. A FLASH of LIGHTNING ignites a FIGURE - floating in the water a few yards from the buoy. The flash was so brief, we‘re not even sure what we saw was real. But then -- another FLASH as -- CU - A WET HAND GRABS on to the BUOY.  62. A DARK FORM bobs in the water next to it. LIGHTNING FLASHES, revealing MARI. Alive. Barely. Her eyes glassy and weak, she stares through the thick rain pounding down on her. MARI‘S POV - The dark house. Waiting just up the narrow path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma enters to find John starting the fire. Krug, Francis, Sadie, Justin looking on.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: No luck with the cell.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: (again eyeing Emma) Looks like we’re still stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Now, Francis, we don’t want to impose -- they’ve done more than enough --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t think you have much choice. It’s okay, we have a couple of spare bedrooms --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Well, that’s mighty kind of you --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (a bit too quickly) Or the guest house... Might work best.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (meaning Mari) You think she'll be okay with that?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Sure, she’s not coming back tonight. It’d be more private.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Whatever you think’s best.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: (again to Emma) We're easy.  63. ON JUSTIN - he’s been sitting on the sofa, sipping his hot chocolate. He finishes.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (re: empty mug) Where should I put this?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Just put it in the kitchen sink. Justin gets up, heads into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin places the mug in the sink, then turns back, but stops in his tracks, spotting something 0.S. cU - A SMALL PHOTO of Mari_and her parents is encased _ i a_glass magnet on the side of the refrigerator. cU - JUSTIN - stares at the picture in dumb shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari pulls herself through the water, crawls up onto the muddy shore, weakly forcing herself to keep moving in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JUSTIN - still staring at the photo in a horrified daze. He turns to come face to face with

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: carrying empty coffee mugs --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (re: photo) Oh -- That’s our daughter, Mari, the car thief. Emma goes to the sink, starts rinsing out the mugs as Justin suddenly doubles-over and THROWS UP a little.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, honey...

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: I‘1l be -- I’m okay... where’s the...  64.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: ...-down the hall. Justin bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin enters and shuts the door behind him, locking it. He quickly sits on the floor between the toilet and the wall, shoving himself into the corner, terrified. A beat. Then -- The doorknob rattles, making him flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krug tries the locked door.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Hey, Just... Doctor Collingwood wants to know if you’re all right in there. So do I.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Fine. I’m fine. Krug lowers his voice to an agitated whisper to talk through the door to Justin.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowering in the corner, Justin looks as if he wants to recede into the wall and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nothing -- will you just give me two seconds?

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Say anything and you’re dead. You hear me? Hurry up. Justin trembles as he listens to KRUG LEAVE. He then digs into his jeans pocket, pulls out MARI’S NECKLACE. Stares at it a long beat. Then squeezes it tight in his hand, shuts his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muted sound of PEOPLE TALKING is heard from the living room as the bathroom door UNLOCKS and slowly opens a little for Justin to stick his head out. Seeing that the coast is clear, he walks into the hall and approaches the living room. JUSTIN’S POV - Through the living room doorway, Krug comes into view as he talks to Emma and John.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You sure we’re not in your way?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, don’t worry about it. It’s no big deal, really. Once things clear up in the morning, we’ll get you outta here one way or another.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. Thank you so much. Concern floods Justin’s face. He looks down, opens his hand, eyes the necklace in his palm, his mind racing. He then ducks into the

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Where he looks around frantically, then eyes the deep kitchen sink. Keeping an eye on the living room doorway, Justin quickly heads to the sink, eyes his red mug sitting in the bottom. He quickly takes out the necklace and places it conspicuously AROUND THE BOTTOM OF THE MUG. KRUG (0.S.) (CONT’D) Ready? Justin whirls around, sees Krug in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re being shown to our room. Justin forces a nod and a half smile, joins Krug in the doorway.  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone dressed in ponchos, Emma, carrying the flashlight and a bundle of candles and matches, rushes through the downpour, leading Krug, Sadie, Francis, and Justin to the guesthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. The door UNLOCKS as the group enters.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Voila. She strikes a match, starts lighting candles...

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Wow, you’ve got your own personal five-diamond Hilton right on your front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I don’t know about that, but it sleeps four pretty comfortably. The couch folds out. Sheets should already be on it. Another bedroom’s in there, let me just check something -- Emma quickly heads off to the

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Where she sees Mari’s duffel bag on the floor. She quickly shoves it under the bed with her foot. Spots Mari’s remaining jewelry on the bedside table. Quickly scoops them into her hand, pockets them just as

dialogues.speaker: KRUG AND FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Enter in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So the bathroom’s in there... can’t say much for the water pressure though. There might be some stuff in the medicine cabinet if Justin feels sick again. Krug and Francis cross the room to approach Emma as she ducks into the bathroom.  67.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're pretty well stocked, I think... Emma turns back for the bedroom and flinches slightly as she finds Krug and Francis standing right in front of her, a little too close. EMMA (CONT’D) Anything you need before we turn in for the night? Krug smiles mechanically.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: No, you’ve done more than enough already. We're perfect, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Well, if you need anything, just -- well, I guess you can’t call us so just -- come on back over and give us a shout.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Will do. But we won’t shout unless the storm’s still going.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Well... Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Goodnight. Emma laughs politely as she passes between Krug and Francis, makes her way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Emma darts back across to the main house we PULL BACK to reveal

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: continuing her agonizing crawl through the pounding rain... she sees her mom...

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Mmm -- mom... She’s too weakened to scream, but she still refuses to give up. Mari keeps pressing forward as lightning FLASHES.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRUG‘S POV - Seen through the window, Emma heads to the main house. Krug watches her all the way, his eyes predatory and unblinking as Francis gazes at her over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: I’d sure like to clear the cobwebs from her cunt. Francis hungrily watches Emma disappear into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is heard CLOSING THE FRONT DOOR as John sits at the table putting away his medical instruments. A muted BANGING is suddenly heard from somewhere in the house, as if something is being blown back and forth in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (calling to Emma
They all set out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma puts her poncho in the closet, a little shaken.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Yeah... they’re fine.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Strange group. Emma enters, heads to the kitchen counter, starts cleaning up. But doesn’t yet notice the necklace in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: That’s the understatement of the year. John pauses to listen to the BANGING.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Do you hear that? Emma turns around, steps away from the kitchen sink --  69.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you leave the porch door open?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I didn’t think I did -- BANG. BANG. BANG. Muffled under the thunder. John and Emma turn toward the sound, their blood running cold. What the hell is that? John heads to the cabinet, takes out the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANGING is louder as John and Emma cautiously enter. A healthy FIRE blazes in the fireplace, creating ghoulish dancing shadows as they approach the sliding glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANGING is even louder now as John and Emma appear on the other side of the glass door. John unlocks the door and slides it open. He aims the flashlight beam around the room... JOHN’S POV - scanning across the porch as rain pounds down on the screened-in room. The flashlight’s beam comes to the porch’s SCREEN-DOOR as it BANGS in the wind. John heads to the door, latches it shut. He then looks down, the beam falling on A TRAIL OF SMALL PUDDLES. John aims the beam along the trail that stops on a pair of wet SNEAKERS poking out from behind the hot tub. John’s eyes widen in horror. He bolts around to the back of the hot tub where

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: comes into view, slouched on her side against it, her blood and water-soaked body limp, her eyes rolling to the back of her head.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: John stumbles to Mari’s side, shaking her as Emma rushes over --  70.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Oh God! Mari!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Mari? Mari, stay with me. He touches his index finger to her neck, feeling for a pulse.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Oh god -- oh my god -- Another FLASH of lightning and ROAR of thunder -- John pulls up Mari’s eyelid --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (panicking) I can’t tell what’s -- John fumbles for the flashlight, frantically using it to examine Mari’s bloody wounds. He pulls back her shredded tank top near her shoulder where the darkest blood stain is --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s been shot --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Do something, John, do something! John shakily lifts Mari into his arms --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Not you, Mari -- not you, too -- you hear me? Over this, John gently lays Mari on top of the covered hot-tub. He looks down to the tub’s digital temperature readout, frantically punches a button, raising the water temp to the max. John checks Mari’‘s pulse again, then quickly starts CPR, pushing on her chest... blowing into her pale mouth...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mari -- one, two, three -- He breathes into her mouth again -- then presses his hands to her chest --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One, two -- Mari suddenly COUGHS up water -- John’s eyes widen --  71.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s it, sweetie -- He gently rolls her on her side, letting the excess water drain from her mouth -- JOHN (CONT’D) Mari, you’re with mom and dad, you’‘re gonna be okay -- We've gotta stop the bleeding -- Emma, go get -- go get blankets, towels...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: What about --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (talking over her) -- any alcohol you brought, and my bag -- John pauses, seeing the raging fire through the glass door in the living room -- an idea:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- put the poker in the fire -- We‘re gonna have to do it the old fashioned way --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: But what about the bullet, John?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Goddammit, right now stopping the bleeding’s more important than fishing for the fucking bullet -- Emma bolts into the living room, JAMS the poker in the center of the fire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadie’s taking a nice, soothing shower by candlelight, the shower rod and curtain hanging diagonally, dangling from just the one end, the other end having collapsed into the tub -- evidently, Sadie had the same issues with it that Mari had earlier. CU - SADIE - eyes closed as the water flows down her scarred face...  72. WITH KRUG - in the bedroom. He sets the silenced gun on the night stand, pulls his shirt off. Collapses to the bed, his legs and feet hanging off the side, just above MARI‘’S DUFFEL BAG stuffed underneath. Krug looks over through the bedroom doorway into the living room, sees Justin’s silhouetted form lying on the pull-out bed.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: You awake in there? No answer. But as we PUSH IN on Justin, we reveal his eyes are in fact WIDE OPEN as he stares back into the bedroom, his gaze fixed on that SILENCED GUN on the bedside table... what else is this kid thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm steam seeps from under the hot tub’s cover as Emma enters, hands John the now RED HOT poker. Sets his medical bag and a stack of towels on the hot-tub cover next to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Still need alcohol --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (heading out) Getting it now --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And try your cell phone again!! Emma bolts away once again as John eyes the poker. Then gently levels it to the ENTRY WOUND on the back of Mari’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, Mari, hold on -- this isn’t gonna feel very good, sweetie, but it’s gotta happen -- A beat -- then John gently wraps his left arm around Mari’s upper chest, bracing her as his right hand touches the poker to her shoulder, cauterizing the wound. As we HEAR Mari’s skin SINGEING 0.S. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma races into the kitchen. Frantically picks up her cell: NO SIGNAL.  73. She opens the cabinet above the counter, grabs a bottle of Jack Daniels. She then turns and sees the sparkling necklace in the sink! Emma SHRIEKS, jumps back, scared shitless. She then peers back into the sink, wide-eyed as she takes in the sight of Mari‘s necklace -- neatly encircling the red mug. Unbelieving, Emma picks it up. She turns the medallion over, sees the inscription. Emma recoils in horror, eyes wide, thoughts racing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John continues to “operate” on Mari. Now noticing dried blood near her knee just below her shorts. He takes his medical scissors, starts cutting away at her shorts but suddenly stops -- noticing a stream of dried blood on her thigh leading up to her underwear. cU - JOHN’S FACE - as he continues, his eyes widen in horror at what he’s seeing 0.S. It’s clear now that John knows his daughter was raped.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No -- god -- John chokes back emotion, raises a shaking hand to his mouth -- JOHN (CONT’D) You fuck -- fff -- fucker -- Suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Starts faintly WHEEZING.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mari? He leans down as her eyes open halfway --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Daddy -- can’t breathe -- can’t --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Okay -- we can fix that -- that’s easy for me, okay? John reaches in his bag, pulls out some medical tape. Anxiously looks around the room, spots Emma’s bag full of Magazines and a larger pair of house scissors.  74. He grabs the bag, dumps out the magazines. He swipes up a magazine, revealing the newspaper Emma was reading and Krug’s face on the front page -- John eyes it, wide-eyed -- frozen in disbelief -- the fury boiling -- another beat, then he re-focuses on Mari, tearing a small section of the magazine’s cover off --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Emma!! Where the hell are-- John whirls around, sees Emma standing there in the darkness. John startles slightly, grabs the bottle of Jack, twists it open, starts pouring it over the scissors.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly to Emma; re: Mari) Her lung’s collapsed -- can you hold her down? Emma nods, still dazed from her discovery as she leans down to Mari --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong -- Emma brings up the necklace.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: It was in the sink -- The kid -- Justin -- I think he put it there-- John hesitates only for a beat, totally overloaded with that one --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Krug, Sadie, Francis) John, they’re --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (nods over to the newspaper ) I_know. Emma sees it -- then --

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Da-- Dad-- John turns back to Mari --  75.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m here, sweetie. Okay, this is gonna hurt a little, but I promise, you’re gonna breathe a lot better -- Emma moves in, grasps Mari‘’s hand -- tight -- John opens the house scissors, pours a little more Jack Daniels over the blades, then proceeds to slice into Mari‘s upper chest above her heart. Mari winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know, sweetie -- almost there -- just letting out some trapped air...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: John -- John grabs a towel, dabs at the blood, then RIPS a piece of medical tape off, affixes it to the section of magazine cover. He then tapes the magazine cover over the small hole he’s just cut into Mari’s chest. As Mari breathes, we see the piece of magazine raise up and down from the escaping air as Mari’s breathing becomes less labored.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How’s that?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Bet -- better --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Good. Just be still. Don’t try to talk. Mari manages a slight smile now. John smiles then eyes Emma. They step away from Mari, John speaking in a hushed whisper: JOHN (CONT’D) She’s stable for now, but we’ve got to get her to a hospital -- (re: necklace) So what about --  76.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I found it in the sink. It was intentionally placed there, wrapped around the mug I gave Justin --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He’s trying to warn us -- John starts trembling in disbelief, the anger seething --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Emma, Mari -- she --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (with extreme difficulty) She -- she was raped -- there was blood -- Emma clasps her hands to her mouth, getting sick --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Emma, listen to me. Are you listening? Emma manages a nod --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, clearly he’s telling us something -- he knows who we are --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (realizing) He saw her picture -- on the fridge -- he saw it and he looked like a goddamned ghost -- oh my god -- I should've seen it... I should’ve -- John eyes Emma a beat, his mind racing. He then eyes Mari for a beat. Then heads quickly into the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where he peers out the window to the guesthouse. Sees the flickering candlelight inside. No movement.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They‘re still in there -- (beat; then) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think the kid’s told them...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Because we’d be dead by now. (then) We‘ve got to get her out of here, the nearest house...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Is six miles from here --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: By land -- (thinks a beat; then) Where are the boat keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Emma rifle through drawers, looking for the missing keys --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t fucking believe this -- how could they not fucking be here?! TI haven’t used the boat in two years.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: My brother did. When he stayed here --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You mean when he stayed in the goddamned _questhouse?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: They could be there or still in the boat --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: God -- shit!

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: John --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (trembling uncontrollably) Alright -- Emma -- Mari’s running out of time, so we’ve -- we’ve -- (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points toward guesthouse) We've got to be ready for anything. Anything. And we've got to be ready to do anything -- to kill those fuckers if we have to -- Whatever it takes. Do you hear me, Emma? off Emma, her eyes never leaving John’s...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin lies in bed. Still wide awake -- he turns over, peers out the window -- JUSTIN’S POV - THE MAIN HOUSE - he catches glimpses of Emma and John’s silhouettes moving around inside, candles being blown out... cU - JUSTIN - clearly wondering -- haven’t they found the necklace yet? Do they know? Sure doesn’t look like it as the house goes dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John frantically RIPS the tarp off the boat, hops inside, aims the flashlight around to the boat’s ignition -- no keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma gently finishes wrapping Mari in a thick blanket.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: There you go, sweetie. Emma sits on the hot tub cover next to Mari whose eyes flutter open. Emma smiles down at her daughter, smooths her hair.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything’s gonna be okay. We’re leaving very soon. Emma kisses Mari on the forehead. Turns to see John standing in the doorway. He shakes his head slightly: “no keys.” Emma nods back. She knows what that means --  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cU - JUSTIN - still lying on the pull-out bed, facing the bedroom doorway. He suddenly sees

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Roll out of bed, head into the bathroom. Justin looks over to Francis who’s nodding off in the lazy boy. Beat. Then -- Justin slides out of bed, tip-toes into the bedroom doorway -- JUSTIN’S POV - Sadie’s in bed. Lightly snoring. Justin sneaks into the bedroom, his feet CREAKING over the floor as he approaches the gun on the bedside table. BACK ON FRANCIS - a lightning flash and roll of thunder wakes him up. He rubs his eyes, groggy. He glances to the pull-out bed. Sees that Justin isn’t there. His brow furrows in suspicion, but then -- he hears the toilet FLUSH 0.S.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: -- the gun now in hand -- whips his head toward the bathroom door -- hears the LOCK unlatching. Justin’s eyes widen. There’s no way he can make it back to the living room in time. WITH KRUG - He exits the bathroom back into the bedroom. As he rounds the bed, we DROP DOWN to reveal

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Hiding underneath the bed, his head right next to Mari’s duffel bag!

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: groggily makes his way around to his side of the bed where his foot suddenly JAMS against something SOLID in Mari‘s duffel bag, stubbing his toe.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Son of a --

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: What? Krug looks down, sees the duffel bag protruding from under the bed.  80. KRUG‘S HAND Reaches down, grabs it. Justin nearly hyperventilates as the bag is suddenly swiped away. Krug lifts up the heavy bag, unzips it, reaches inside and pulls out one of Mari’s jogging weights. Then one more, then a wrist band --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What the fuck -- He stuffs everything back in the bag, tosses it aside. Falls back to the bed, blows out the candle next to the gun Justin put back on the table. Close call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters, aims the flashlight around. Heads to the workbench where he picks up a large WRENCH. He hefts the simple weapon, testing its weight, looking down at it in nervous apprehension. He puts it back on his tool table with a trembling hand and picks up a big HAMMER, testing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cU - EMMA’S HAND pulls a BUTCHER’S KNIFE from its place in the knife-holder. She stares down at the enormous weapon, a mirror of John’s nervous apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey there. Emma YELPS in surprise and spins around to see Francis standing just ten feet from her. FRANCIS (CONT’D) Sorry, sorry, I thought you heard me come in. I saw the fire still going. Figured you were both night owls. Emma smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Uh, just me. John’s asleep. Emma breathes hard, staring at Francis in frozen terror.  sl.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: That last lightning bolt woke me up. Thought maybe a cold beer might help put me back to sleep. Francis turns for the fridge. Emma’s eyes widen. Francis is about to see the family photo!

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Wait -- Francis turns back.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think a cold beer’s gonna cut it. Not on a night like this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Well, what is gonna cut it, Mrs. Collingwood?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I think a warmer adult beverage --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Adult beverage, huh? We fall into that category? Francis moves closer, eyeing Emma’s cleavage beneath her button down blouse.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I think we do.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Then I guess you’re my bartender. Maybe a little Jack Daniels --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (an icy glare) We just ran out of that. You a wine drinker? Francis smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Guess I am tonight.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Then you're in luck. Emma walks to the knife on the counter. She eyes it in trembling uncertainty as she reaches up to the wine shelf, grabs a bottle --  82.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That rain letting up any?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Ah, it’s not that bad out there anymore. Emma turns and freezes in surprise as she sees that Francis has come closer to stand right in front of her. Emma flinches a little as Francis reaches past her. He leisurely picks up the knife from the counter. FRANCIS (CONT’D) I think the storm’s finally on its way out. Francis slides the knife back into its empty place in the knife-holder and smiles at Emma innocently. A beat. FRANCIS (CONT’D) Do I get a glass or do you want me to chug it straight from the bottle?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Glasses. Right. Sorry. Emma goes to the fridge and smoothly slides the photo off the door and slips it in her jeans pocket just as Francis turns and approaches. Emma goes up on her tiptoes, opens the cabinet above the fridge, pulls out two wine glasses.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we go. Francis eyes her ass hungrily, but quickly raises his eyes to meet hers again as she turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: (smiling) Thanks. Francis suddenly pauses -- FRANCIS (CONT’D) Now all we need’s -- Francis suddenly stops short -- seeing something 0.8. FRANCIS’S POV - peering through the living room and sliding glass door to Mari lying on the hot tub on the back porch.  83.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- Holy fucking -- He turns back. Emma is standing right behind him. She SMASHES the WINE BOTTLE across his face!!

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: You fucking animals. Francis stumbles back toward the living room, looks up only to come face to face with JOHN - stepping into the doorway, the HAMMER raised. SMACK! John BASHES Francis’ jaw in. Francis stumbles to the side in stunned shock, hitting the counter, SHATTERING some dinnerware -- John SWINGS at him again but misses, the hammer SMASHING through a cabinet next to Francis’ head -- Terrified, Francis turns to escape, but runs right into the business end of that shiny BUTCHER KNIFE. Francis freezes in shock. Looks down to see the knife protruding from his chest. He looks up, his dying eyes meeting those of

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Staring at him as he slinks to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you do to my daughter? Huh? Were you the one that shot her? Raped her?! Francis’ eyes widen in shock, the full knowledge of what’s happening overtaking him -- Francis CRIES OUT in GURGLING wretchedness, choking on his own blood as

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Strides over, brings up the hammer once again, flips it around so that the claws face out. THUNK! He SMASHES the claws down into the top of Francis’ head, bloodily DRIVING them into his skull. Francis instantly goes limp, his eyes wide and glassy, his mouth frozen open in a gaping silent scream.  84. A strange quiet fills the room as John and Emma stand over Francis’ motionless body. They both slowly look out the window to the guesthouse. No visible movement inside as Emma PULLS the knife from Francis’ motionless body.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We‘ve gotta do this quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slowly opens. John cautiously slips inside with his hammer in hand. Emma follows with her knife. Both eye the empty pull-out bed: Justin’s not there. John eyes the dark, partially-open doorway leading to the bedroom and looks at Emma. WNods to the chest of drawers. Emma tip toes over to the chest, slides the drawers open anxiously looking for the boat keys. She turns to John, shakes her head -- they’re not here. John swallows and quietly moves to the door. Carefully reaches out and eases it open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door CREAKS. John winces as a lightning flash ignites the dark bedroom. He sees Krug and Sadie sleeping in the bed. Krug wears only pants, while Sadie’s in her underwear. John warily glances across the room and freezes, his eyes widening in shock as he sees

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: sitting huddled in the far corner of the room. AWAKE and looking just as surprised and terrified as he is. Emma appears over John’s shoulder, also FREEZES at the sight of Justin. The three stare at each other in uncertainty. And then -- Justin raises Krug’s gun and AIMS IT AT JOHN AND EMMA!  85. John and Emma instinctively back away -- raise their hands. Take it easy, kid -- easy -- cU - JUSTIN - his hand trembling -- tears streaming down his face -- he snivels -- then -- he suddenly turns the gun around and extends his arm further toward John and Emma. And they realize -- He wants them to take the gun. John nods to Justin. Then carefully steps forward across the creaking hardwood floor that’s only partially muted by the thunder and downpour. John keeps walking, warily keeping his eyes on Justin. CREAK. He steps on another loose FLOORBOARD. John freezes as Krug GROANS and shifts in bed. Emma tenses from the doorway... Krug stays asleep. Relieved, John keeps going, closing in on the gun as Justin quietly stays in his place. John reaches out -- and gently takes it out of Justin’s outstretched hand. A beat of eyes on terrified eyes. Justin then looks away as John turns to the bed and raises the gun, aiming it point blank at Sadie just as a BOLT OF LIGHTNING strikes just outside. The CRASH of thunder wakes Sadie and Krug up. Sadie bolts upright in bed, sees John’s silhouette standing over her!

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: no! Sadie rolls away as John SHOOTS. BAM! The bullet strikes her in the side of her neck. Sadie SCREAMS in agony as Krug dives out of the bed, grabs one of Mari’s jogging weights he found in her duffel and hurls it back at John, SMACKING him in the shoulder just as he FIRES. Emma charges for Krug who grabs another weight and throws it at her, forcing her to dive back into the living room. John whirls back only to be tackled by a SCREAMING and FLAILING Sadie.  86. SADIE (CONT’D) You fucking cocksucker, what the fuck are you doing?! She’s beating her arms on John who drops the gun, forced to fight her off.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off me -- John gains the upper hand, grabs Sadie and tosses her aside, sending her sliding into the bathroom. With that, John grabs the gun, raises up and FIRES at Krug who has grabbed and is now HEAVING the mattress up and over toward John! John dives and rolls from underneath it, takes aim and FIRES at Krug, just missing him as

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: DIVES through the window in a hail of shattered glass. John stumbles out awkwardly from under the mattress, gets to his feet and charges to the window. Looks out to see Krug running away through the downpour, heading for the main house. John raises the gun and FIRES. Misses. ON JOHN - pissed. Behind him --

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: emerges from the bathroom, grabs a lamp off the bedside table. Emma sees her.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: John! John whirls around.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: flings the lamp at John who bats it away -- FIRES back blindly -- misses --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You fucking bitch!! That was my daughter! !  87.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (not missing a beat) Well, your daughter was a little cunt fuck! This as Sadie grabs Justin and drags him back into the bathroom. Emma pursues, but she’s not in time. Sadie SLAMS the door in her face.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: John heads over, KICKS the door. BAM!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Frantically grabs the SHOWER ROD in a hail of plaster as

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: SLAMS his body against the bathroom door. BAM! It SMASHES open —- WHACK! Sadie SMACKS John in the jaw with the shower rod, sending him to the floor. The gun drops from his hand and skips out the door -- Sadie raises the shower rod to strike John again, but --

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: No! Justin charges Sadie and jumps on her back, clawing at her face!

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Godammn you little shit! Sadie throws Justin away. He tumbles into the bathtub. He gets up only to face the wrath of Sadie. She CLOCKS him with the shower rod. Justin hits the edge of the tub, falls limp -- out cold. Sadie turns back to face John. SADIE (CONT’D) Stay the fuck away! John takes a step forward, looking for an opening -- CRASH! SMASH! Sadie wildly knocks the contents of the bathroom to the floor, BASHING holes in the plaster walls, the mirror as she goes absolutely BERSERK, thrashing like a cornered animal gone insane --  88. SADIE (CONT’D) I’11 fucking kill you!! Sadie charges for John just as

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Appears in the doorway and levels the gun at Sadie.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: John, GET DOWN! John drops as -- BAM! Emma FIRES. SHOOTS Sadie center forehead, spattering her blood against the tile wall as her body slides to the floor. Emma coldly lowers the gun. Stands frozen for a beat. Then hands the gun back to John who wordlessly accepts it. He steps toward the tub, reaches down to Justin. Turns him over. He’s still out. John feels for a pulse. Turns to Emma, his mind racing --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (re: house) I’m gonna go look again, there’s a couple of places --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (re: Krug) John, he could be --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Emma, keep looking here. Five minutes, that’s it, otherwise... (beat; knows this option is all but hopeless, but) .--We'll go on foot. They step back into the bedroom. John raises the gun, ready for anything as Emma starts searching the bedside table drawers... As John cautiously makes his way out, keeping the gun aimed ahead at all times --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krug enters, stumbles around in the darkness, feeling his way along the wall toward the living room...  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma‘s tearing the room apart looking for the keys --

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Goddammit! ! She empties another drawer -- nothing. She spins around, stops cold at the sight of Justin -- staring at her from the bathroom door. A tense beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (groggily) What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krug heads to the window, spots John making his way toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Who are these crazy fucks? Krug shakes his head, ducks through the glass sliding door onto the

dialogues.speaker: BACK PORCH
dialogues.text: Where we think he’s going to see Mari lying on the hot tub -- but Mari’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma enters with the flashlight. She shines it over to the boat to reveal MARI wrapped warmly in a robe and towels, lying in the boat‘s back seat! Emma leans over her. Mari’s eyes open, shift up to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Hang on, sweetie. We're still -- we might -- we might have to do this another way... Evidently, the keys haven’t turned up yet. Off this --  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krug studies the remains of John’s operation on Mari: Bloody towels, pieces of her ripped clothing... Krug picks up the shredded piece of Mari’s tank top.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch -- Krug eyes John’s medical bag -- sifts through it, finds a pocket planner, box of surgical gloves, and John’s wallet -- Flips through it. Pockets the cash. Krug suddenly hears a CREAK 0.S. He looks over, spots the poker. Grabs it. INT. COLLINGWOOD HOUSE - LIVING ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER The front door is shoved open and John aims the gun into the dark room. Empty and silent. John cautiously enters, heads to a small chest against the wall next to the fireplace. He slides the drawer open, sees a few keys. Frantically picks through them, not finding what he needs. He suddenly stops, catching sight of something 0.S:

dialogues.speaker: HIS WALLET
dialogues.text: Lying in the middle of the coffee table, conspicuously flipped open to a family photo of John, Emma, and Mari. John nods, scoffs to himself, realizing: Krug _ knows. A CREAK from somewhere within the house. Then another -- from the ceiling. John swallows, determination filling his eyes. He raises the gun.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (calling out) Come on out, you piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SECOND FLOOR HALLWAY - NIGHT —- CONTINUOUS Krug rolls his eyes at the sound of those three words. He stands against the wall, calls back out to John --  gl.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Now why would I do that, John? You have a gun. John moves into the

dialogues.speaker: FOYER
dialogues.text: He peers up to the SECOND FLOOR LANDING

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are the odds, huh? You ever see that old movie, how’s it go -- “Of all the gin joints on the planet, I end up here.” of course, looking back, your daughter had a lot to do with that. Brandishing the gun, John slowly ascends the stairs... There's a sudden lull in the storm. Only the quiet patter of a light rain on the roof. Krug shifts his head, suddenly hearing a few loud CREAKS from the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can hear you, Doc... WITH KRUG - He backs down the hallway, ducks into the

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You‘ve got a pretty determined kid, I’1ll give you that. She’s caused me a helluva lot of heartache today. Why don’t you tell me where you and mom stashed her so I can thank her personally one more time. Krug raises the poker, backs away behind a bookshelf near the window and waits --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SECOND FLOOR LANDING
dialogues.text: reaches the top of the stairs and looks around at the empty hall and doorways of the upper floor. John hardens himself and presses forward, slowly approaching the guest bedroom door.  92. WITH KRUG - He hears the creaks, raises the poker. But something 0.S. Catches his eye. He peers out the window, sees the STREAK OF A FLASHLIGHT BEAM dancing around down by the lake. A lightning flash illuminates the distant

dialogues.speaker: BOAT HOUSE
dialogues.text: KRUG (CONT’D) Well, well... A daring escape by water, huh John?! Krug slides the window up as lightning FLASHES and

dialogues.speaker: THUNDER ROLLS --
dialogues.text: CU - JOHN - hearing that, races down to the bedroom --

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: John barges into the guest bedroom, sees the open window, curtains blowing in the wind -- John races to the window, looks out -- HIS POV - KRUG - outside, heading briskly down the path toward the boat house!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: NO! Emma! shit -- John’s about to jump out the window when -- REVERSE ANGLE - OVER JOHN’S SHOULDER - A hulking figure approaches him from behind -- poker raised -- no, THIS IS KRUG. A FLASH of LIGHTNING casts Krug’s shadow over John. John WHIRLS around, raises the gun -- WHACK! Krug belts him across the arm, sending the gun flying out the window. John turns back, dives to the floor just as Krug SWINGS and misses, SMASHING the poker into the wall as

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE ON THE PATH
dialogues.text: The figure we really saw -- JUSTIN -- nears the boathouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side door opens and Justin steps in. Emma whirls around, aims the flashlight. Justin holds up a _set of keys_on a _bobber key chain.  93.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: This them?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Thank god... yes... She grabs them, anxiously pokes her head out the door, looks up to the main house, deeply concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK! Krug hits John in the back with the poker. Krug’s just playing now. Enjoying this. John hits the floor, staggers to the landing’s railing, grabs it, tries to pull himself up.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Lemme help you there, doc. Krug raises his foot and KICKS John hard, sending him through the railing. At the last second, John grabs one of the railing’s supports as it pops free of the foundation. John dangles over the floor. Krug SMACKS his hand with the poker. John lets go and plummets to the floor. But it’s not nearly as long a fall as it would have been.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FOYER
dialogues.text: John hits the floor with a tremendous THUD as pieces of railing fall around him. John moans and stirs, starting to come around as

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Stalks down the stairs, flips the poker around --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your little girl and her friend put up quite a fight, doc. John reacts to the mention of Mari’s “friend” as Krug strokes the tip of the poker -- KRUG (CONT’D) You wanna know what I did to Mari? I think you do. I think you wanna know what it felt like -- Krug leans down over a still groggy John and readies the poker, gripping it as if he’s about to shove it up between John’s legs.  94. Krug starts the horrific motion to do just that when -- the familiar SOUND of a COCKING GUN 0.S. STOPS HIM COLD. He slowly turns, comes face to face with -- JUSTIN - standing RIGHT BEHIND HIM aiming the silenced gun POINT BLANK, his moist eyes wide and terrified.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Stopping you. Forever. Krug quickly softens, taking a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Justin. Don’t do anything stup -- Justin pulls the trigger -- CLICK. The gun’s empty. Krug flinches in surprise, staring at the barrel pointed at him as he realizes his son just tried to shoot him. Equally surprised, Justin stares at the useless weapon. Krug swings the poker, KNOCKS Justin to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure picked a funny moment to grow some balls. Justin tries to crawl away, but Krug quickly yanks him up off the floor, gets in his face: KRUG (CONT’D) But it’s too late. Because I -- don‘t like you anymore. Krug holds Justin in place as he pushes the poker hard into Justin’s abdomen -- Justin looks at Krug, eyes wide in fear as Krug presses harder, the poker breaking the skin now, blood seeping through Justin's sweatshirt --

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (gasping) Better -- look --

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What --

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Better look out you fuck --  95. Krug realizes that Justin is referring to the figure

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HIM --
dialogues.text: Krug whirls around to see Emma brandishing the FIRE EXTINGUISHER. She SPRAYS an explosive barrage of pressurized foam into Krug’s face -- Krug CRIES OUT, drops the poker, stumbles back with his hands to his blinded eyes as John get to his feet, angrily GRABS the fire extinguisher from Emma and advances toward Krug. SLAM! He HITS Krug in the head with the extinguisher. Krug stumbles back. SLAM! John hits him again. Krug stumbles back against a table. Emma comes up behind the winded John who hands her back the fire extinguisher. Her turn. She SWINGS. WHAM! Krug drops to the floor. Very bloodied, half dead or worse as John and Emma stand over him. off this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU - MARI - She opens her eyes, looks up at her mom sitting next to her. Emma smiles, moves her hand down to Mari’s waist, revealing the BUTCHER KNIFE firmly clasped in Mari’s hands. Emma gently takes it. Kisses Mari on the forehead as John starts the motor, backs the boat out into the open water... Justin sits silently in the front passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ski-boat ROARS away across the lake, we PULL BACK to reveal the scattered homes and the town on the horizon as the electricity returns... lights flickering back to life... CUT TO BLACK. A silent beat. Then, suddenly -- we have FLASHES of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A scalpel SHINES in an eerie light... - A PAIR OF HANDS don surgical gloves... - The scalpel PIERCES deep into bare skin...  96. - WIDER - the hands work the scalpel, pushing it deeper into the middle of a MAN’S BACK. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cU - KRUG - his eyes pop open. HIS POV - peering up at the eerie fluorescent work light above him as JOHN leans into frame.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hi. Reveal Krug, lying across John’s work bench.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You‘re feeling the effects of general anesthesia.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I can’t move.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (raising the bloody scalpel) Because I’ve paralyzed you from the neck down. Krug’s eyes shift as John wheels over a tall tool box The MICROWAVE OVEN sits on top.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: What are you doing? John doesn’t answer as he wheels the mocrowave to behind Krug’s head, then nods to someone O.S.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who’s there? Who's -- Another MAN we’ve never seen before enters frame. He’s 50ish, weathered... a BLACK PATCH over his right eye, both sadness and rage in his left.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: This is James Griffen.  97.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: I don’t know you. I don’t know him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That’s okay, he knows you. You murdered his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: Oh fuck -- no -- James leans down to Krug --

dialogues.speaker: JAMES GRIFFEN
dialogues.text: Her name was Paige. Krug’s eyes widen as James quietly rolls the open microwave over Krug’s head.

dialogues.speaker: KRUG
dialogues.text: No -- don’t -- what the fuck -- James’ finger moves to the microwave’s keypad, punches in a 20-second count. James looks to John who then moves his finger to the microwave -- and presses START. The microwave HUMS to life as John and James quickly head from the room -- cU - KRUG - wide-eyed as the microwave starts to FRY AND MELT HIS FACE -- KRUG SCREAMS -- Just as his HEAD POPS --
